attributes.action: Include Liquor permits in visa process for tourists to 'dry states' in India.
attributes.additional_details: The British Government can represent the thousands of British tourists in order to convince the Indian Government to make the whole process a lot simpler.  This would probably increase revenue for the government ran liquor stores.  The permit process is currently unclear and is proving difficult for many to get hold of.
attributes.background: There are thousands of British tourists visiting India throughout the year.  A lot of them visit 'dry states', such as Gujarat, where liquor is only available to those that hold a permit.  Permits are only issued to tourists and it is becoming increasingly difficult to get hold of them.

rejection.details: Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
